channel.title: Comments on: Small data with Elixir
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: josevalim
item.dc:creator: josevalim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/03/small-data-with-elixir/comment-page-1/#comment-1743">Matías Reyes</a>.
It may or may not be a performance issue. While writing Flow and GenStage itself, I ran only once into a situation which required speeding up and I used the process dictionary in those cases. ETS tables would also have worked though.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Matías Reyes.

It may or may not be a performance issue. While writing Flow and GenStage itself, I ran only once into a situation which required speeding up and I used the process dictionary in those cases. ETS tables would also have worked though.

item.title: By: Matías Reyes
item.dc:creator: Matías Reyes
item.description: This is a great topic! and Flow is amazing! I have read that immutability has bad performance for data & number crunching. I don't know if It's proven, but if it's true, we should be using ETS tables all over?
item.content:encoded:
This is a great topic! and Flow is amazing!
I have read that immutability has bad performance for data & number crunching. I don’t know if It’s proven, but if it’s true, we should be using ETS tables all over?

item.title: By: Tamori Hirofumi
item.dc:creator: Tamori Hirofumi
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/03/small-data-with-elixir/comment-page-1/#comment-1727">josevalim</a>.
As I told to you at Elixirconf Japan, I translated this blog into Japanese. http://qiita.com/HirofumiTamori/items/8e076d28ef40d98d99f1 Sorry for late notice. I'm looking forward to your next post.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to josevalim.

As I told to you at Elixirconf Japan, I translated this blog into Japanese.
http://qiita.com/HirofumiTamori/items/8e076d28ef40d98d99f1
Sorry for late notice. I’m looking forward to your next post.

item.title: By: josevalim
item.dc:creator: josevalim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/03/small-data-with-elixir/comment-page-1/#comment-1726">Tamori Hirofumi</a>.
Thank you! I have fixed the example!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tamori Hirofumi.

Thank you! I have fixed the example!

item.title: By: Tamori Hirofumi
item.dc:creator: Tamori Hirofumi
item.description: Hello, it is a quite suggestive post, thanks! I found the bug in the sample code, File.stream!("path/to/file", :line) should be File.stream!("path/to/file", [], :line) or File.stream!("path/to/file") as stream!/3's signature is stream!(path, modes \ [], line_or_bytes \ :line).
item.content:encoded:
Hello, it is a quite suggestive post, thanks!
I found the bug in the sample code, File.stream!(“path/to/file”, :line) should be File.stream!(“path/to/file”, [], :line) or File.stream!(“path/to/file”) as stream!/3’s signature is stream!(path, modes \ [], line_or_bytes \ :line).

item.title: By: Boshan Sun
item.dc:creator: Boshan Sun
item.description: Looking forward to the coming series!
